Are you trying to boot an existing windows partition with vmware from within ubuntu, or create a new windows virtual machine from within ubuntu?

In beta, vm server 2 didn't support booting from an existing partition, if my memory is right.  So you'll find that older tutorials mention that ability when in server 2 (beta -- I haven't tried the latest release -- notes are online at: http://www.vmware.com/support/server2/doc/releasenotes_vmserver2.html)

What I meant was, the tutorials show the option to boot from an existing partition, but in server 2 beta the option didn't exist.  I'd check the release notes, download 2 from vmware's site, install it and find out for yourself
